intro: Debregeasia atrata, commonly known as the black-leaved daphne, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Thymelaeaceae and is characterized by its dark, glossy leaves and clusters of small, fragrant flowers. The plant produces yellowish-orange fruits that contain seeds, which are dispersed by animals. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade, making it suitable for rock gardens and dry landscapes. Due to its unique appearance and ornamental value, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and by horticulturists.
